scenario: Prestigious laboratory placement decisions involve negotiations among faculty researchers, department heads, and doctoral candidates with varying funding situations and undisclosed interpersonal dynamics.
task: Develop a comprehensive placement plan that balances research interests, funding allocations, and student mentorship priorities while navigating the complexities of private funding situations and interpersonal relationships. Agents must strategically share information to build consensus while safeguarding sensitive details that could influence placement decisions or project directions.

agents.name: Faculty Researcher
agents.role: Oversees student placements in their laboratory, ensuring alignment with research goals and funding requirements.
responsibilities: Align laboratory projects with departmental objectives.

Funding Source (undisclosed donor).reason: Disclosure could jeopardize future funding and partnerships.

Candidate Performance (secret test resul.reason: Sensitive data that could bias placement decisions.

public.Lab Research Focus: Innovative applications of machine learning in biology

agents.name: Department Head
agents.role: Responsible for overall departmental strategy and resource allocation, including placement decisions.

agents.name: Doctoral Candidate
agents.role: Seeks placement in a laboratory that aligns with their research interests and funding opportunities.

success_criteria.Placement Agreement: All parties agree on final placements that align with faculty interests, departmental goals, and candidate aspirations.
success_criteria.Funding Alignment: Consensus on funding allocations that meet the financial needs of the selected candidates and departmental priorities.
success_criteria.Mentorship Resolution: Agreement on mentorship roles that satisfy both faculty expectations and candidate developmental needs.

deliverable: A detailed placement plan outlining candidate placements, funding allocations, and mentorship assignments.

public: Research proposals aligned with departmental focus
private: No undisclosed funding sources among candidates
Funding applications must be submitted by deadlines

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -200, -150, -100). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +80, +70, +60).
Consensus_w: Negotiation is required to align on placements, funding, and mentorship roles.
